page.title: 02Housing
page.content: There are nearly two hundred houses in Tetsworth. Two are thatched cottages. Some of the houses are more than three hundred years old and many more have old foundations, beams and walls. Some of the older buildings are reputed to have gardens which are laid out the same today as they were in the last century. There has been a lot of building in the village over the past fifty years. Marsh End, an estate of houses,flats and bungalows was built on the edge of a marsh. More recently an estate was built on the site of a large house called the "Laurels". Near the church is the old vicarage, built at the time of the church itself. A block of old people's flats was built in the 1970s. Detached houses are being built today opposite the telephone exchange.
